intro: Trophaeum, commonly known as the common marsh plant, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in poorly drained soils. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense mats, which can help stabilize soil in wetland areas. Trophaeum plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat for various invertebrates and contributing to nutrient cycling.
